[[Image:VII_SEVEN.png|frame]]
'''''SEVEN: An Anglo-American Literary Review''''' (also spelled '''''VII: An Anglo-American Literary Review''''') is an annual journal of scholarship on seven British authors: [[Owen Barfield]], [[Wikipedia:G.K. Chesterton|G.K. Chesterton]], [[C.S. Lewis]], [[George MacDonald]], [[Wikipedia:Dorothy L. Sayers|Dorothy L. Sayers]], [[J.R.R. Tolkien]], and [[Charles Williams]].<ref>{{webcite|articleurl=https://journals.wheaton.edu/index.php/vii/about|articlename=About the Journal|website=[https://journals.wheaton.edu/index.php/vii/index VII: Journal of the Marion E. Wade Center]|accessed=14 August 2025}}
</ref>

The journal was founded in [[1980]] by Dr. [[Clyde S. Kilby]], Dr. Barbara Reynolds and Dr. Beatrice Batson, and is published by the [[Marion E. Wade Center]].<ref>{{webcite|articleurl=https://journals.wheaton.edu/index.php/vii/history|articlename=History|website=[https://journals.wheaton.edu/index.php/vii/index VII: Journal of the Marion E. Wade Center]|accessed=14 August 2025}}
</ref> The journal has published 40 issues.<ref>{{webcite|articleurl=https://journals.wheaton.edu/index.php/vii/article_index|articlename=Contents By Volume|website=[https://journals.wheaton.edu/index.php/vii/index VII: Journal of the Marion E. Wade Center]|accessed=14 August 2025}}</ref>

While most of the volumes include at least one article related to Tolkien, two issues are noteworthy for containing formerly [[Index:Unpublished material|unpublished quotes]] from [[Index:Writings by J.R.R. Tolkien|writings by Tolkien]]:
*[[SEVEN 17|VII: An Anglo-American Literary Review, Volume 17]] ([[2000]])
*[[SEVEN 27|VII: An Anglo-American Literary Review, Volume 27]] ([[2010]])
